reference.title: Run Configurations dialog
reference.shortdesc: A run configuration brings together all of the information needed to run a specific executable on a specific device instance, making it simple to repeatedly run that executable on that device instance.

section.p: You can create different run configurations in order to run or debug WebUIAndroid applications or widgets on real or emulated devices. A run configuration encapsulates all of the information relating to a single execution scenario into a single entity. It identifies not only the specific package within a particular project to be run, but the device on which it is to be run. By creating multiple run configurations, you can quickly and easily switch between them to try out different scenarios.
The Run Configurations dialog appears when you select Run Configurations from the Run menu and then either create or select an existing Android Application using Studio for Android configuration.

strow.stentry: Specifies the project that contains the application to be run.
Specifies the package that corresponds to the application to be run. The package can either be a .descriptor or a .mpkg file.
Specifies the device instance on which the application should run. This can be either a real or an emulated device.

Specifies the certificate to be used to sign the application before transferring it to the device. If the chosen instance is a MOTOMAGX Emulator, this field is disabled; you can only specify a certificate if the run configuration is for a physical device.

Specifies the activity that should be launched, if any. Often you will just want the default activity to be launched, but you can specify a specific activity by selecting Launch and indicating the activity to be launched. If the project should be installed but not run (as might be in the case of a widget), select Do Nothing.
